title: Zero tolerance on high tackles is correct even though clumsy and criminal are treated the same
text:
I’ve taken a lot of knocks to the head. Between my father, South Africans and the old school Northern opensides that used to hunt me down, I’ve been properly clattered. So I agree with World Rugby’s focus on player welfare and its initiatives to reduce the risk of head injuries. Head-high tackles, dangerous tackles, no arm tackles need to be dealt with. The consequences of not doing so can be life changing and life threatening.

It wasn't so long ago that physios used to put the magic sponge on the back of your neck and then tap out the number of fingers the referee was holding up, or whisper in your ear that “it’s Saturday, 10-4 up, West Hartlepool”. Players didn’t want to come off, and if they...
